com.jidesoft.swing
Interface GlobalEventHandler

Deprecated. use AWTEventListener instead.

public interface GlobalEventHandler

GlobalEventHandler is an interface that allows any AWTEvent to be processed. It works with GlobalEventQueue to process any events before applicatio processes them.

For example, you want to define a special keystroke in your application. No matter where you are, press that keystroke will always do a certain thing. It is hard to do in normal way but with the help of GlobalEventQueue it’s very easy. Below is an example of register a handler for ESC key. It is guaranteed to be triggered no matter where you are. 

  GlobalEventQueue.getInstance().addGlobalEventHandler(new GlobalEventHandler() {
      public void handle(AWTEvent event) {
          if (event.getID() == KeyEvent.KEY_PRESSED && ((KeyEvent) event).getKeyCode() == KeyEvent.VK_ESCAPE) {
              // ESC key is pressed, do something here
          }
      }
  });
Note: Since the GlobalEventHandler.handle() method will be called for every single AWT event, please make sure the code in it is executed as quickly as possible and return as soon as possible. You can add as many handlers as you want. However try to combine them as one. If one handler is not used anymore, immediately remove it from GlobalEventQueue.
